description: From Ancient Greek συναίρεσις (sunaíresis, “unification”), from συν- (sun-, “together”) + αἵρεσις (haíresis, “taking”), from αἱρέω (hairéō, “I take”).

entries.meaning: (linguistics, prosody) the contraction of two vowels into a diphthong or a long vowel.
(chemistry) the separating out of the liquid from a gel.
